{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3140374,"name":"AfterTen","username":"AfterTen","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/afterten/{size}/11780_2.png","created_at":"2023-02-06T04:39:36.945Z","cooked":"

Every time I power up the robot the yaw of the pigeon 2 is ~-90
I would expect it to be zero on power up.

Have done a factory reset using Tuner.
All the mounting orientations are set to zero.
I mean I can fix this by setting the Yaw Pose to -90, but why should I?

","post_number":1,"post_type":1,"posts_count":9,"updated_at":"2023-02-06T04:39:36.945Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":837,"reads":363,"readers_count":362,"score":4302.6,"yours":false,"topic_id":425899,"topic_slug":"ctre-pigeon-2-always-powers-up-with-a-yaw-of-90","display_username":"AfterTen","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"link_counts":[{"url":"https://www.chiefdelphi.com/t/issues-with-pigeon2-both-seem-to-be-broken/440969/2","internal":true,"reflection":true,"title":"Issues with Pigeon2, both seem to be broken","clicks":1}],"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":3}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":27113,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"3572 Wavelength - Programming Mentor"},"post_url":"/t/ctre-pigeon-2-always-powers-up-with-a-yaw-of-90/425899/1","custom_user_title":"3572 Wavelength - Programming Mentor","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":3}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":3,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":true,"can_vote":false},{"id":3141259,"name":"Emile Hamwey","username":"EmileH","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/emileh/{size}/254137_2.png","created_at":"2023-02-07T14:10:34.474Z","cooked":"

We on 3467 are experiencing the same behavior.

@Jacob_C we’d like to avoid calling setYaw(0) on robotInit() so that the gyro yaw is persistent across deploys. What’s the correct API call to configure the starting yaw to be zero?

","post_number":2,"post_type":1,"posts_count":9,"updated_at":"2023-02-07T14:10:34.474Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":9,"reads":303,"readers_count":302,"score":125.6,"yours":false,"topic_id":425899,"topic_slug":"ctre-pigeon-2-always-powers-up-with-a-yaw-of-90","display_username":"Emile Hamwey","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":1}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":23820,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"On permanent sabbatical | he/him "},"post_url":"/t/ctre-pigeon-2-always-powers-up-with-a-yaw-of-90/425899/2","custom_user_title":"On permanent sabbatical | he/him ","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":1,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":true},{"id":3141292,"name":"Mark S.","username":"MarkS987","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/marks987/{size}/189668_2.png","created_at":"2023-02-07T15:26:18.962Z","cooked":"

By any chance, in Robot Initialize, do you have the pigeon reset factory defaults as well as set it to 0.0? In this case however, it would also be a good idea to have a zeroing button to set the pigeons zero however way you are facing. Especially if you are working with Swerve Drive.

","post_number":3,"post_type":1,"posts_count":9,"updated_at":"2023-02-07T15:26:18.962Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":5,"reads":271,"readers_count":270,"score":84.2,"yours":false,"topic_id":425899,"topic_slug":"ctre-pigeon-2-always-powers-up-with-a-yaw-of-90","display_username":"Mark S.","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"link_counts":[{"url":"https://www.chiefdelphi.com/t/pigeon-2-0-field-relative-randomly-switching-forward-to-left-of-robot/429872/3","internal":true,"reflection":true,"title":"Pigeon 2.0/Field Relative randomly switching forward to left of robot","clicks":1}],"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":49042,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":""},"post_url":"/t/ctre-pigeon-2-always-powers-up-with-a-yaw-of-90/425899/3","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":true},{"id":3141319,"name":"AfterTen","username":"AfterTen","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/afterten/{size}/11780_2.png","created_at":"2023-02-07T16:00:55.776Z","cooked":"

No, I tested this on a RoboRio with just the temporary server deployed to the roborio. So no user code.

","post_number":4,"post_type":1,"posts_count":9,"updated_at":"2023-02-07T16:00:55.776Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":3,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":4,"reads":254,"readers_count":253,"score":70.8,"yours":false,"topic_id":425899,"topic_slug":"ctre-pigeon-2-always-powers-up-with-a-yaw-of-90","display_username":"AfterTen","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":49042,"username":"MarkS987","name":"Mark S.","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/marks987/{size}/189668_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":27113,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"3572 Wavelength - Programming Mentor"},"post_url":"/t/ctre-pigeon-2-always-powers-up-with-a-yaw-of-90/425899/4","custom_user_title":"3572 Wavelength - Programming Mentor","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":true},{"id":3141321,"name":"Cory","username":"TytanRock","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/tytanrock/{size}/167849_2.png","created_at":"2023-02-07T16:04:39.185Z","cooked":"

The Pigeon 2 does boot to nonzero yaw due to an artifact in how we do our sensor fusion. This has been the case since the Pigeon 2 launched.
We’ve never changed that behavior for a couple reasons:

  • Teams likely still need to set the yaw to 0 before the match starts to account for…
    • Change in yaw between power-up and match start (setting up the robot, moving it while in setup, etc)
    • Any drift between power-up and match start (especially since it takes a couple seconds for a no-motion calibration to occur on power-up)
  • Up to now, no one has asked for this change

But this doesn’t mean we’re opposed to changing this. It’s just that the value of this feature appears minimal to us since teams likely need to set yaw anyway.

EmileH:

so that the gyro yaw is persistent across deploys

You may not have intended this interpretation, but I want to be clear.
I don’t think the Pigeon 2 will ever “remember” the last yaw and boot to it. This is because the Pigeon 2 will likely have rotated between the time it powered-off and powered back on, and it doesn’t know how much it’s rotated while it’s been off.
Maybe what you’re looking for is a boot to “absolute” mode, which is also unlikely in FRC, as it requires the use of the magnetometer (which causes more, different, issues in FRC than it solves).

","post_number":5,"post_type":1,"posts_count":9,"updated_at":"2023-02-07T16:04:39.185Z","reply_count":2,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":1,"incoming_link_count":47,"reads":238,"readers_count":237,"score":352.6,"yours":false,"topic_id":425899,"topic_slug":"ctre-pigeon-2-always-powers-up-with-a-yaw-of-90","display_username":"Cory","primary_group_name":"CTRE","flair_name":"CTRE","flair_url":"/uploads/default/original/3X/1/b/1bd2b430e1bb6427d1c6504ff6abcd31de851a6d.png","flair_bg_color":"","flair_color":"","flair_group_id":57,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":4}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":26269,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"7762 Mentor, CTRE Engineer, CSA"},"post_url":"/t/ctre-pigeon-2-always-powers-up-with-a-yaw-of-90/425899/5","custom_user_title":"7762 Mentor, CTRE Engineer, CSA","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":4}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":4,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":true,"topic_accepted_answer":true},{"id":3141329,"name":"AfterTen","username":"AfterTen","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/afterten/{size}/11780_2.png","created_at":"2023-02-07T16:10:36.071Z","cooked":"

Thanks, don’t need it changed I just like to know 100% as much as possible why things work the way they do and this was unexpected to me since I would have thought yaw would be ~0 on power up.
Is the power up Yaw “random” but consistent per unit or is the -90 value typical?
Is this behavior in the user manual? If it is, sorry I missed it and could have saved the trouble. If it isn’t please include it since this was unexpected to me.

","post_number":6,"post_type":1,"posts_count":9,"updated_at":"2023-02-07T16:10:36.071Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":5,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":17,"reads":223,"readers_count":222,"score":134.6,"yours":false,"topic_id":425899,"topic_slug":"ctre-pigeon-2-always-powers-up-with-a-yaw-of-90","display_username":"AfterTen","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":26269,"username":"TytanRock","name":"Cory","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/tytanrock/{size}/167849_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":27113,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"3572 Wavelength - Programming Mentor"},"post_url":"/t/ctre-pigeon-2-always-powers-up-with-a-yaw-of-90/425899/6","custom_user_title":"3572 Wavelength - Programming Mentor","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":true},{"id":3141332,"name":"Emile Hamwey","username":"EmileH","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/emileh/{size}/254137_2.png","created_at":"2023-02-07T16:18:12.577Z","cooked":"

We could implement a yaw offset ourselves, which is fine. Like @AfterTen mentioned this behavior is not outlined anywhere in the manual or documentation which led us to believe it was faulty or some kind of configuration issue on our part.

I’m specifically referring to between deploys while robot power stays on (and the Pigeon stays on) but the user program is restarted, wherein re-zeroing the yaw of the IMU would be an inconvenience if the robot has moved from down-field-zero heading.

","post_number":7,"post_type":1,"posts_count":9,"updated_at":"2023-02-07T16:18:12.577Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":5,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":9,"reads":208,"readers_count":207,"score":91.6,"yours":false,"topic_id":425899,"topic_slug":"ctre-pigeon-2-always-powers-up-with-a-yaw-of-90","display_username":"Emile Hamwey","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":26269,"username":"TytanRock","name":"Cory","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/tytanrock/{size}/167849_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":23820,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"On permanent sabbatical | he/him "},"post_url":"/t/ctre-pigeon-2-always-powers-up-with-a-yaw-of-90/425899/7","custom_user_title":"On permanent sabbatical | he/him ","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":true},{"id":3141338,"name":"Cory","username":"TytanRock","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/tytanrock/{size}/167849_2.png","created_at":"2023-02-07T16:24:58.542Z","cooked":"

I don’t believe we’ve characterized multiple Pigeon 2’s with regard to boot-up yaw so I can’t say for sure, but I suspect they will consistently boot to -90 degrees. There is a small blurb in the users manual that mentions this, which I’ve snipped below.

EmileH:

I’m specifically referring to between deploys while robot power stays on (and the Pigeon stays on) but the user program is restarted, wherein re-zeroing the yaw of the IMU would be an inconvenience if the robot has moved from down-field-zero heading.

Ah, that makes sense. In that case I’d point you to the getUpTime() method. While not perfect, it should at least give you an idea that the Pigeon2 has been recently booted or has been on for a while and you can make a decision to set its yaw based on that.
